name: Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Family Nurse Practitioner

Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study i: Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Family Nurse Practitioner The Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study (CAGS) in Family Nurse Practitioner is designed to allow a registered nurse with at least a Master’s of Science in Nursing (MSN) to obtain a nurse practitioner certification by completing the required coursework to prepare for the certification exam.

courses.subject: NURS
courses.title: Epidemiology Health Promotion and Disease Management

courses.subject: NURS
courses.title: Nurse Practitioner Role: History, Practice Regulations, Reimbursement and Ethics

courses.subject: NURS
courses.title: Adult Acute and Chronic Disease Management

notes: Total Required Credits for the Program: 22 s.h. Foundation Courses A GAP analysis will be performed on every applicant’s MSN transcript. The coordinator of the particular concentration will determine which CORE courses are needed prior to entering the concentration. Graduation/Exit, Benchmark, and/or Thesis Requirements Exit Survey is required. Minimum Required Grades and Cumulative GPA The Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Family Nurse Practitioner is a Category 2 program requiring a minimum of B- in all courses. For details regarding satisfactory academic progress and graduation requirements, please visit Academic Program Policy Categories Program Coordinator/Advisor Contact Information Dr. Matthew Kaspar 856.256.5127 kaspar@rowan.edu
